page.title: 03Woodlands
page.content: The areaa is very well wooded on the higher central area between the valleys of the Umborne and the Offwell Brook. The largest area is in the care of the Forestry Commission and comes under the tile of the Neroche Forest. Part of this 'forest' can be found miles away in Somerset and also in the Colytin area. The trees are of both carboniferous and deciduous types. There is also an area which is used for growing the fast growing conifers - a cash crop. Until recently there were a great number of fine elms, but these have virtually all been felled as a result of Dutch Elm disease. The lower levels of the river valleys are also pleasantly wooded. Widworthy & Watchcome Woods are of typically English mixed trees. West of Home Bush is a small area of rather stunted woodland & heathland.
